snippet.title: Amber Heard blames Johnny Depp's 'abuse on drugs and alcohol', court documents claim
snippet.description:
Amber Heard 'will remain close to Johnny Depp's daughter Lily-Rose despite divorce
Although the actress has split from Lily-Rose's dad, the pair are expected to stay in touch
Amber Heard will reportedly stay close to Johnny Depp 's daughter despite the breakdown of their marriage.

It was revealed this week that the actress had filed for divorce from the Pirates of the Caribbean actor 15 months after they tied the knot, but it is said it won't affect her friendship with Lily-Rose.
Speaking to E! News , a source said: "Amber and Lily-Rose developed a strong bond early on. Amber and Lily-Rose spent many days together without Johnny; going shopping, going out to eat, the movies.
It is said things came to a head last month shortly after they were forced to appear in an embarrassing apology video, after illegally bringing their dogs into Australia, which made them a global laughing stock.

“Johnny felt humiliated by the whole ordeal and believes Amber made him look like a fool," a source told the paper.
“It just doesn’t fit with his serious image and he hated being mocked. The dogs are Amber’s so she should really have done the thorough checks
Actress Amber Heard has been granted the right to stay in the home she shared with Johnny Depp after she was awarded a temporary restraining order against him.
The Drive Angry star - who has claimed she was subject to domestic violence from her estranged husband - asked for the house they shared, their dogs, and their Range Rover as part of her court documents. amid the abuse allegations.
Amber, 30, was pictured with a bruised face as part of her court claim.
Now the judge has granted the temporary restraining order, requiring Johnny to stay 100 yards away from Amber until a court hearing in June
